app.database.models package

Submodules

app.database.models.auth module

auth_models.py

Database models for authentication-related activities.

Provides Pydantic models for user registration, login, and JWT token handling.

class app.database.models.auth.TokenData(*, user_id: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Model representing decoded JWT token data.

Parameters:

user_id – ID of the user associated with the token (optional).

get_uuid() → UUID | None[source]

Convert user_id to UUID if present.

Returns:

UUID object if user_id is set, None otherwise.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

user_id: int | None
class app.database.models.auth.TokenResponse(*, access_token: str, token_type: str)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Model representing JWT access token response.

Parameters:

  • access_token – JWT access token string.

  • token_type – Type of the token (usually ‘bearer’).

app.database.models.comment module

comment_models.py

Database models for comments-related activities.

Provides SQLModel and Pydantic models for creating, reading, and storing comments associated with events and users.

class app.database.models.comment.Comment(*, id: int | None = None, event_id: int, user_id: int, content: str, created_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing a comment.

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the comment.

  • event_id – Foreign key referencing the related event.

  • user_id – Foreign key referencing the author user.

  • content – Text content of the comment.

  • created_at – Timestamp when the comment was created.

app.database.models.event module

event_models.py

Database models for event-related activities.

Provides SQLModel and Pydantic models for storing events, creating new events, and updating existing events.

class app.database.models.event.Event(*, id: int = None, name: str, location: str, photo: bytes | None = None, time: datetime, description: str | None = None, owner_id: int)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing an event.

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the event.

  • name – Name of the event.

  • location – Location where the event takes place.

  • photo – Optional photo stored as bytes (no external cloud storage).

  • time – Date and time of the event.

  • description – Optional description of the event.

  • owner_id – ID of the user who owns/created the event.

description: str | None
id: int
location: str

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str
owner_id: int
photo: bytes | None
time: datetime

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for updating an existing event.

All fields are optional; only provided fields will be updated.

Parameters:

  • name – Optional updated name of the event.

  • location – Optional updated location.

  • photo – Optional updated photo as bytes.

  • time – Optional updated date and time.

  • description – Optional updated description.

app.database.models.event_invitation module

event_invitation.py

Database models for invitation link related activities.

Provides SQLModel table for storing event invites for users, including token hash and event association.

class app.database.models.event_invitation.EventInvitation(*, id: int | None = None, token_hash: str, event_id: int, created_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing an event invitation link.

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the event pass.

  • token_hash – SHA-256 hash of the pass token (unique, indexed).

  • event_id – ID of the event the pass grants access to.

  • created_at – Timestamp when the pass was created (UTC).

created_at: datetime
event_id: int
id: int | None

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

app.database.models.event_pass module

event_pass_models.py

Database models for invitation link (event pass) related activities.

Provides SQLModel table for storing event passes (magic links) for guests and users, including token hash, event association, and display name.

class app.database.models.event_pass.EventPass(*, id: int | None = None, token_hash: str, event_id: int, user_id: int | None = None, display_name: str, created_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing an event pass (invitation link).

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the event pass.

  • token_hash – SHA-256 hash of the pass token (unique, indexed).

  • event_id – ID of the event the pass grants access to.

  • user_id – Optional ID of the user bound to the pass.

  • display_name – Display name of the guest or user associated with the pass.

  • created_at – Timestamp when the pass was created (UTC).

created_at: datetime
display_name: str
event_id: int
id: int | None

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

user_id: int | None

app.database.models.participations module

participation_models.py

Database models for participation-survey related activities.

Provides SQLModel and Pydantic models for tracking user participation statuses in events, including going/maybe/not going options.

class app.database.models.participations.EventParticipation(*, id: int | None = None, user_id: int, event_id: int, status: ~app.database.models.participations.ParticipationStatus, created_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>, updated_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing a user’s participation in an event.

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the participation record.

  • user_id – ID of the user participating.

  • event_id – ID of the event.

  • status – Participation status (going / maybe / not_going / invited).

  • created_at – Timestamp when participation was created.

  • updated_at – Timestamp when participation was last updated.

created_at: datetime
event_id: int
id: int | None

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

status: ParticipationStatus
updated_at: datetime
user_id: int

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for creating a participation record.

Parameters:

status – Participation status (going / maybe / not_going)

status: ParticipationStatus
class app.database.models.participations.ParticipationStatus(*values)[source]

Bases: str, Enum

Enum representing possible participation statuses for an event.

Options: - going: user will attend the event - maybe: user may attend - not_going: user will not attend - invited: user has been invited

going = 'going'
invited = 'invited'
maybe = 'maybe'
not_going = 'not_going'

app.database.models.user module

user_models.py

Database models for User-related activities.

Provides SQLModel and Pydantic models for users, including guest users, password management, and API response structures.

class app.database.models.user.User(*, id: int | None = None, login: str, email: str | None, hashed_password: str | None, created_at: ~datetime.datetime = <factory>, is_guest: bool = False)[source]

Bases: SQLModel

Database table model representing a user.

Parameters:

  • id – Primary key of the user.

  • login – User login or display name.

  • email – Optional email address (unique, indexed).

  • hashed_password – Optional hashed password for authentication.

  • created_at – Timestamp of user creation (UTC).

  • is_guest – Boolean indicating whether the user is a guest.
